page.title: 14Denstone Hall Farm.
page.content: Denstone Hall Farm is owned by Mr and Mrs Boden.Altogether the farm has 248 acres of land.There are 180 dairy cows,56 calves and 25 young dairy cows for future stock.Mr.Boden has Hereford, Friesian and Charolais cattle.The cows are milked twice a day at 6am.and 3pm. The milk then goes to Fole dairy. Inside the bulk tank there is a blade that moves round to keep the milk cool. On the farm there are also 20 ewes and 35 lambs.They are kept for meat and wool.The cows are fed a mixture of sugar beet,leftover cornflakes,pellets, fishmeal,barley and other crops. Grass is grown for silage,potatoes for sale,barley for cows and wheat for flour.At Christmas time they rear turkeys to sell.Mr Boden gets up early every morning to start work at 5.30am. They have a guard dog called Benji.
